summary: Email correspondence from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York regarding the preparation and service of a subpoena related to the Epstein investigation. The email includes instructions for including contact information for a Forensic Accountant and Special Agent, and requests electronic forwarding of results to the FBI.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Sends email requesting preparation of a subpoena and provides instructions for its content and service.

persons.name: Forensic Accountant
persons.context: Contact person listed in the subpoena instructions for questions; likely involved in financial investigation.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.context: Contact person listed in the subpoena instructions; results are to be forwarded to this agent at the FBI's New York Field Office.

connections.description: The AUSA is coordinating with the FBI Special Agent on the subpoena process, indicating joint investigative efforts.
The AUSA includes the Forensic Accountant as a contact in the subpoena, showing coordination on the financial investigation.
Both are listed as contacts in the subpoena instructions, suggesting they are working together on the investigation.

events.title: Subpoena Preparation Request
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney requests the preparation and service of a subpoena related to the Epstein investigation, with specific instructions for including contact information for investigators.

locations: Southern District of New York, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
FBI New York Field Office, 26 Federal Plaza, New York, NY 10278
keyFacts: The document is an email dated September 26, 2019, from an Assistant United States Attorney in the SDNY regarding a subpoena in the Epstein investigation.
The subpoena instructions include contact information for a Forensic Accountant and an FBI Special Agent, indicating an active financial investigation.
Results from the subpoena are to be forwarded electronically to the FBI's New York Field Office.
The document demonstrates ongoing legal and investigative activity by the SDNY and FBI in late 2019, after Epstein's death.
